HorizontalStackProps.name: HorizontalStackProps

members.name: accessibilityLabel
members.description:
A label that describes the purpose or contents of the element. When set,
it will be announced to buyers using assistive technologies and will
provide them with more context.

members.name: horizontalAlignment
members.description: Position children along the main axis

members.name: verticalAlignment
members.description: Position children along the cross axis

members.name: accessibilityRole
members.description:
Sets the semantic meaning of the component’s content. When set,
the role will be used by assistive technologies to help users
navigate the page.

members.name: gap
members.description: Adjust spacing between children

members.name: rowGap
members.description: Adjust spacing between children in the block axis

members.name: columnGap
members.description: Adjust spacing between children in the inline axis

members.name: padding
members.description:
Adjust the padding.

To shorten the code, it is possible to specify all the padding for all edges of the box in one property.

- `base` means block-start, inline-end, block-end and inline-start paddings are `base`.
- `base none` means block-start and block-end paddings are `base`, inline-start and inline-end paddings are `none`.
- `base none large` means block-start padding is `base`, inline-end padding is `none`, block-end padding is `large` and inline-start padding is `none`.
- `base none large small` means block-start padding is `base`, inline-end padding is `none`, block-end padding is `large` and inline-start padding is `small`.
- `true` applies a default padding that is appropriate for the component.

Learn more about the 1-to-4-value syntax at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Shorthand_properties#edges_of_a_box

members.name: paddingBlock
members.description:
Adjust the block-padding.

- `base none` means block-start padding is `base`, block-end padding is `none`.

members.name: paddingBlockStart
members.description: Adjust the block-start padding.

members.name: paddingBlockEnd
members.description: Adjust the block-end padding.

members.name: paddingInline
members.description:
Adjust the inline padding.

- `base none` means inline-start padding is `base`, inline-end padding is `none`.

members.name: paddingInlineStart
members.description: Adjust the inline-start padding.

members.name: paddingInlineEnd
members.description: Adjust the inline-end padding.

members.name: blockSize
members.description:
Adjust the block size.

- `number`: size in pixels.
- `` `${number}%` ``: size in percentages of the available space.

members.name: minBlockSize
members.description:
Adjust the minimum block size.

- `number`: size in pixels.
- `` `${number}%` ``: size in percentages of the available space.

members.name: maxBlockSize
members.description:
Adjust the maximum block size.

- `number`: size in pixels.
- `` `${number}%` ``: size in percentages of the available space.

members.name: inlineSize
members.description:
Adjust the inline size.

- `number`: size in pixels.
- `` `${number}%` ``: size in percentages of the available space.

members.name: minInlineSize
members.description:
Adjust the minimum inline size.

- `number`: size in pixels.
- `` `${number}%` ``: size in percentages of the available space.

members.name: maxInlineSize
members.description:
Adjust the maximum inline size.

- `number`: size in pixels.
- `` `${number}%` ``: size in percentages of the available space.

LinkProps.name: LinkProps

members.name: id
members.description: A unique identifier for the link.

members.name: href
members.description:
The URL to link to.
If set, it will navigate to the location specified by `href` after executing the `onClick` callback.

members.name: to
members.description:
Alias for `href`
If set, it will navigate to the location specified by `to` after executing the `onClick` callback.

members.name: tone
members.description:
Sets the link color.

- `inherit` will take the color value from its parent,
giving the link a monochrome appearance. In some cases,
its important to pair this property with another stylistic treatment,
like an underline, to differentiate the link from a normal text.

members.name: onClick
members.description:
Callback when a link is pressed. If `href` is set,
it will execute the callback and then navigate to the location specified by `href`.

members.name: onPress
members.description:
Alias for `onClick`
Callback when a link is pressed. If `href` is set,
it will execute the callback and then navigate to the location specified by `href`.

members.name: accessibilityLabel
members.description:
A label used for users using assistive technologies. When set, any
`children` supplied to this component will not be announced to screen reader users.

members.name: language
members.description:
Indicate the text language. Useful when the text is in a different language than the rest of the page.
It will allow assistive technologies such as screen readers to invoke the correct pronunciation.
[Reference of values](https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry) ("subtag" label)

members.name: lang
members.description: Alias for `language`

SelectProps.name: SelectProps

members.name: disabled
members.description: Whether the select can be changed.

members.name: error
members.description:
Indicate an error to the user. The field will be given a specific stylistic treatment
to communicate problems that have to be resolved immediately.

members.name: id
members.description:
A unique identifier for the field. When no `id` is set,
a globally unique value will be used instead.

members.name: label
members.description: Content to use as the field label.

members.name: name
members.description:
An identifier for the field that is unique within the nearest
containing `Form` component.

members.name: onBlur
members.description: Callback when focus is removed.

members.name: onChange
members.description:
A callback that is run whenever the selected option changes. This callback
is called with the string `value` of the selected `option`. This component
is [controlled](https://reactjs.org/docs/forms.html#controlled-components),
so you must store this value in state and reflect it back in the `value`
prop of the select.

members.name: onFocus
members.description: Callback when input is focused.

members.name: options
members.description:
The options a user can select from.

When both `options` and children `Option` or `OptionGroup` are provided,
the options will be merged together, with the `options` property
taking precedence.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: A short hint that describes the expected value of the field.

members.name: readOnly
members.description: Whether the field is read-only.

members.name: required
members.description:
Whether the field needs a value. This requirement adds semantic value
to the field, but it will not cause an error to appear automatically.
If you want to present an error when this field is empty, you can do
so with the `error` prop.

members.name: value
members.description:
The active option for the select. This should match to one of the
`value` properties in the `options` property or one of the `<Option>`.
When not set, the value will default to an empty string,
which will show the `placeholder` text as the "selected value".

OptionDescription.name: OptionDescription

members.name: disabled
members.description: Whether this option can be selected or not.

members.name: label
members.description: The user-facing label for this option.

members.name: value
members.description:
The value that will be passed to the select’s `onChange` callback
when this option is selected.

OptionGroupDescription.name: OptionGroupDescription

members.name: disabled
members.description: Whether the options within this group can be selected or not.

members.name: label
members.description: The user-facing label for this group of options.

members.name: options
members.description: The options a user can select from.
